title: [DEMO CHANGE] Build Your First Robotic Arm (Simulation + Kinematics with Python)
subtitle: Build Your First Robotic Arm

instructor.name: Harpreet Singh
instructor.bio: Harpreet Singh is a Full Self-Driving (FSD) & Robotics Engineer with 5+ years of expertise in AI-driven autonomy, specializing in motion planning, computer vision, and simulation, who has mentored 10,000+ students globally while founding two award-winning Robotics/AI startups recognized by Startup India and Punjab Government, combining deep technical knowledge in AI decision-making and sensor fusion with a passion for advancing intelligent systems through engineering, education and entrepreneurship.

whatYouWillLearn: How to build and simulate your first robotic arm - from scratch
Core principles of robot architecture: joints, links, motion control
A behind-the-scenes look at real-world robotic control systems in industry

about.description: This free live webinar gives you a real, hands-on experience in modern robotics. You won't just watch - you'll build a robotic arm step-by-step, understand its math, and simulate its motion using Python and open-source tools.
buildLive: A working forward kinematics system to compute end-effector position
An inverse kinematics module to reach target points
Live robotic arm simulation using open-source tools like PyBullet or CoppeliaSim
Command-line interface to control joint angles and target points

whoIsThisFor.title: Students
whoIsThisFor.description: Get a real start into robotics with coding and simulations. Perfect for engineering, computer science, or robotics students.

whoIsThisFor.title: Developers
whoIsThisFor.description: Learn real math and control logic behind robotic arms. Ideal for software engineers looking to build robotic systems.

whoIsThisFor.title: Career Switchers & Makers
whoIsThisFor.description: Break into the field of robotics & automation. Start building real-world robot systems.
